docfields.name: KIconButton
docfields.text: Pressing on the button will open a KIconDialog for the user to select an icon The current icon will be displayed on the button KIconDialog A push button that allows selection of an icon

docfields.name: KIconButton::KIconButton
docfields.text: parent The parent widget

docfields.name: KIconButton::KIconButton
docfields.text: loader The icon loader to use parent The parent widget

docfields.name: KIconButton::setButtonIconSize
docfields.text: KIconLoader::StdSizes buttonIconSize 4.1

docfields.name: KIconButton::setIconSize
docfields.text: KIconLoader::StdSizes iconSize

docfields.name: KIconButton::setIconType
docfields.text: Use KIconLoader::NoGroup if you want to allow icons for any group in the given context

docfields.name: KIconButton::setStrictIconSize
docfields.text: When true only icons of the specified group s size in setIconType() are allowed and only icons of that size will be shown in the icon dialog

docfields.name: KIconDialog
docfields.text: Use the function getIcon() to let the user select an icon An icon selection dialog

docfields.name: KIconDialog::KIconDialog
docfields.text: parent The parent widget

docfields.name: KIconDialog::KIconDialog
docfields.text: loader The icon loader to use parent The parent widget

docfields.name: KIconDialog::openDialog
docfields.text: the name of the icon suitable for loading with KIconLoader getIcon

docfields.name: KIconDialog::setCustomLocation
docfields.text: Only local directory paths are allowed

docfields.name: KIconDialog::setIconSize
docfields.text: KIconLoader::StdSizes iconSize

docfields.name: KIconDialog::setStrictIconSize
docfields.text: policy When true only icons of the specified group s size in getIcon() are shown When false icons not available at the desired group s size will also be selectable

docfields.name: KIconDialog::showDialog
docfields.text: QString() will be emitted if the dialog was aborted

docfields.name: KIconDialog::getIcon
docfields.text: group The icon group this icon is intended for Providing the group shows the icons in the dialog with the same appearance as when used outside the dialog context The initial icon context Initially the icons having this context are shown in the dialog The user can change this strictIconSize When true only icons of the specified group s size are shown otherwise icon not available in the desired group s size will also be selectable iconSize the size of the icons the default of the icon group if set to 0 user Begin with the instead of parent The parent widget of the dialog caption The caption to use for the dialog The name of the icon suitable for loading with KIconLoader

docfields.name: KIconEffect
docfields.text: This class applies effects to icons depending on their state and group For example it can be used to make all disabled icons in a toolbar gray Various Effects applied to an image QIcon::fromTheme

docfields.name: KIconEffect::Effects
docfields.text: Note that LastEffect is no valid icon effect but only used internally to check for invalid icon effects NoEffect Do not apply any icon effect ToGray Tints the icon gray Colorize Tints the icon with a specific color ToGamma Change the gamma value of the icon DeSaturate Reduce the saturation of the icon ToMonochrome Produces a monochrome icon

docfields.name: KIconEffect::KIconEffect
docfields.text: You will most likely never have to use this to create a new KIconEffect yourself as you can use the KIconEffect provided by the global KIconLoader which itself is accessible by KIconLoader::global() through its iconEffect() function

docfields.name: KIconEffect::apply
docfields.text: The effect to apply depends on the group and state parameters and is configured by the user src The image group The group for the icon see KIconLoader::Group state The icon s state see KIconLoader::States An image with the effect applied

docfields.name: KIconEffect::apply
docfields.text: src The image effect The effect to apply one of KIconEffect::Effects value Strength of the effect 0 value 1 rgb Color parameter for effects that need one trans Add Transparency if trans true An image with the effect applied

docfields.name: KIconEffect::apply
docfields.text: src The pixmap group The group for the icon see KIconLoader::Group state The icon s state see KIconLoader::States A pixmap with the effect applied

docfields.name: KIconEffect::apply
docfields.text: src The pixmap effect The effect to apply one of KIconEffect::Effects value Strength of the effect 0 value 1 rgb Color parameter for effects that need one trans Add Transparency if trans true A pixmap with the effect applied

docfields.name: KIconEffect::doublePixels
docfields.text: src the image the scaled image

docfields.name: KIconEffect::fingerprint
docfields.text: This is useful for caching group the group see KIconLoader::Group state the state see KIconLoader::States the fingerprint of the given group+ state

docfields.name: KIconEffect::hasEffect
docfields.text: group the group to check see KIconLoader::Group state the state to check see KIconLoader::States true if an effect is configured for the given group in state otherwise false KIconLoader::Group KIconLoader::States

docfields.name: KIconEffect::colorize
docfields.text: image The image col The color with which the image is tinted value Strength of the effect 0 value 1

docfields.name: KIconEffect::deSaturate
docfields.text: image The image value Strength of the effect 0 value 1

docfields.name: KIconEffect::overlay
docfields.text: src The image overlay The image to overlay src with

docfields.name: KIconEffect::semiTransparent
docfields.text: image The image

docfields.name: KIconEffect::semiTransparent
docfields.text: pixmap The pixmap

docfields.name: KIconEffect::toGamma
docfields.text: image The image value Strength of the effect 0 value 1

docfields.name: KIconEffect::toGray
docfields.text: image The image value Strength of the effect 0 value 1

docfields.name: KIconEffect::toMonochrome
docfields.text: image The image white The color with which the white parts of image are painted black The color with which the black parts of image are painted value Strength of the effect 0 value 1

docfields.name: KIconEngine
docfields.text: Currently this class is not much more than a wrapper around QIconEngine However it should not be difficult to extend with features such as SVG rendered icons Icon themes specifying a KDE-Extensions string list setting will limit themselves to checking these extensions exclusively in the order specified in the setting Hamish Rodda

docfields.name: KIconEngine::KIconEngine
docfields.text: iconName the name of the icon to load iconLoader The KDE icon loader that this engine is to use overlays Add one or more overlays to the icon See KIconLoader::Overlays KIconLoader

docfields.name: KIconLoader
docfields.text: KIconLoader will load the current icon theme and all its base themes Icons will be searched in any of these themes Additionally it caches icons and applies effects according to the user s preferences In KDE it is encouraged to load icons by An icon group is a location on the screen where icons are being used Standard groups are Desktop Toolbar MainToolbar Small and Panel Each group has some centrally configured properties bound to it including the icon size and effects This makes it possible to offer a consistent icon look in all KDE applications The standard groups are defined below KIconLoader::Desktop Icons in the iconview of konqueror kdesktop and similar apps KIconLoader::Toolbar Icons in toolbars KIconLoader::MainToolbar Icons in the main toolbars KIconLoader::Small Various small typical 16x16 places titlebars listviews and menu entries KIconLoader::Panel Icons in kicker s panel The icons are stored on disk in an icon theme or in a standalone directory The icon theme directories contain multiple sizes and/or depths for the same icon The iconloader will load the correct one based on the icon group and the current theme Icon themes are stored globally in share/icons or application specific in share/apps/ The standalone directories contain just one version of an icon The directories that are searched are and Icons in these directories can be loaded by using the special group

docfields.name: KIconLoader::Any
docfields.text: Some icon with unknown purpose

docfields.name: KIconLoader::Action
docfields.text: An action icon e.g save print

docfields.name: KIconLoader::Application
docfields.text: An icon that represents an application

docfields.name: KIconLoader::Device
docfields.text: An icon that represents a device

docfields.name: KIconLoader::FileSystem
docfields.text: An icon that represents a file system Use Place instead

docfields.name: KIconLoader::MimeType
docfields.text: An icon that represents a mime type or file type

docfields.name: KIconLoader::Animation
docfields.text: An icon that is animated

docfields.name: KIconLoader::Category
docfields.text: An icon that represents a category

docfields.name: KIconLoader::Emblem
docfields.text: An icon that adds information to an existing icon

docfields.name: KIconLoader::Emote
docfields.text: An icon that expresses an emotion

docfields.name: KIconLoader::International
docfields.text: An icon that represents a country s flag

docfields.name: KIconLoader::Place
docfields.text: An icon that represents a location e.g home trash

docfields.name: KIconLoader::StatusIcon
docfields.text: An icon that represents an event

docfields.text: No group

docfields.name: KIconLoader::Desktop
docfields.text: Desktop icons

docfields.text: First group

docfields.name: KIconLoader::Toolbar
docfields.text: Toolbar icons

docfields.text: Main toolbar icons

docfields.name: KIconLoader::Small
docfields.text: Small icons e.g for buttons

docfields.name: KIconLoader::Panel
docfields.text: Panel Plasma Taskbar icons

docfields.name: KIconLoader::Dialog
docfields.text: Icons for use in dialog titles page lists etc

docfields.text: Last group

docfields.name: KIconLoader::MatchExact

docfields.name: KIconLoader::emitChange
docfields.text: It will also trigger a reload in all of them to update to the new theme group indicates the group that has changed 5.0

docfields.text: since 5.0 use emitChange(Group)

docfields.name: KIconLoader::KIconLoader
docfields.text: appname Add the data directories of this application to the icon search path for the group The default argument adds the directories of the current application extraSearchPaths additional search paths either absolute or relative to GenericDataLocation Usually you use the default iconloader which can be accessed via KIconLoader::global() so you hardly ever have to create an iconloader object yourself That one is the application s iconloader

docfields.name: KIconLoader::addAppDir
docfields.text: Assume the icons are in png the base directory would be KIconLoader automatically searches themeBaseDir This directory must contain a dir structure as defined by the XDG icons specification appname The application name themeBaseDir The base directory of the application s theme eg

docfields.name: KIconLoader::alphaBlending
docfields.text: group the group to check true if alpha blending is desired

docfields.name: KIconLoader::currentSize
docfields.text: Using e.g KIconLoader::SmallIcon will retrieve the icon size that is currently set from System Settings- Appearance- Icon sizes SmallIcon for instance would typically be 16x16 but the user could increase it and this setting would change as well group the group to check the current size for an icon group

docfields.name: KIconLoader::drawOverlays
docfields.text: overlays List of up to 4 overlays to blend over the pixmap The first overlay will be in the bottom left corner followed by bottom right top right and top left An empty QString can be used to leave the specific position blank pixmap to draw on 4.7

docfields.name: KIconLoader::iconEffect
docfields.text: the KIconEffect

docfields.name: KIconLoader::iconPath
docfields.text: name The name of the icon without extension If an absolute path is supplied for this parameter iconPath will return it directly group_or_size If positive search icons whose size is specified by the icon group group_or_size If negative search icons whose size is group_or_size See KIconLoader::Group and KIconLoader::StdSizes canReturnNull Can return a null string If not a path to the icon will be returned the path of an icon can be null or the icon when not found depending on canReturnNull

docfields.name: KIconLoader::loadAnimated
docfields.text: If you want to load a mng animation as QMovie instead please use loadMovie() instead name The name of the icon group The icon group See loadIcon() size Override the default size for group See KIconLoader::StdSizes A QStringList containing the absolute path of all the frames making up the animation

docfields.name: KIconLoader::loadIcon
docfields.text: It will try very hard to find an icon which is suitable If no exact match is found a close match is searched If neither an exact nor a close match is found a null pixmap or the pixmap is returned depending on the value of the canReturnNull parameter name The name of the icon without extension group The icon group This will specify the size of and effects to be applied to the icon size If nonzero this overrides the size specified by group See KIconLoader::StdSizes state The icon state DefaultState ActiveState or DisabledState Depending on the user s preferences the iconloader may apply a visual effect to hint about its state overlays a list of emblem icons to overlay by name drawOverlays path_store If not null the path of the icon is stored here if the icon was found If the icon was not found path_store is unaltered even if the pixmap was returned canReturnNull Can return a null pixmap If false the pixmap is returned when no appropriate icon has been found Note a null pixmap can still be returned in the event of invalid parameters such as empty names negative sizes and etc the QPixmap Can be null when not found depending on canReturnNull

docfields.name: KIconLoader::loadIconSet
docfields.text: Loading itself is done by calling loadIcon name The name of the icon without extension group The icon group This will specify the size of and effects to be applied to the icon size If nonzero this overrides the size specified by group See KIconLoader::StdSizes canReturnNull Can return a null iconset If false iconset containing the pixmap is returned when no appropriate icon has been found the icon set Can be null when not found depending on canReturnNull use QIcon::fromTheme instead which uses the iconloader internally

docfields.name: KIconLoader::loadMimeTypeIcon
docfields.text: This is basically like loadIcon except that extra desktop themes are loaded if necessary iconName The name of the icon without extension usually from KMimeType group The icon group This will specify the size of and effects to be applied to the icon size If nonzero this overrides the size specified by group See KIconLoader::StdSizes state The icon state DefaultState ActiveState or DisabledState Depending on the user s preferences the iconloader may apply a visual effect to hint about its state path_store If not null the path of the icon is stored here overlays a list of emblem icons to overlay by name drawOverlays the QPixmap Can not be null the pixmap is returned when no appropriate icon has been found

docfields.name: KIconLoader::loadMovie
docfields.text: name The name of the icon group The icon group See loadIcon() size Override the default size for group See KIconLoader::StdSizes parent The parent object of the returned QMovie A QMovie object Can be null if not found or not valid Ownership is passed to the caller

docfields.name: KIconLoader::loadPixmapSequence
docfields.text: name The name of the icon without extension size the size/group to be used 5.0

docfields.name: KIconLoader::moviePath
docfields.text: name The name of the icon group The icon group See loadIcon() size Override the default size for group See KIconLoader::StdSizes the full path to the movie ready to be passed to QMovie s constructor Empty string if not found

docfields.name: KIconLoader::queryIcons
docfields.text: group_or_size If positive search icons whose size is specified by the icon group group_or_size If negative search icons whose size is group_or_size See KIconLoader::Group and KIconLoader::StdSizes context The icon context a list of all icons

docfields.name: KIconLoader::queryIconsByContext
docfields.text: group_or_size The icon preferred group or size If available at this group or size those icons will be returned in other case icons of undefined size will be returned Positive numbers are groups negative numbers are negated sizes See KIconLoader::Group and KIconLoader::StdSizes context The icon context A QStringList containing the icon names available for that context

docfields.name: KIconLoader::queryIconsByDir
docfields.text: iconsDir the directory to search in A QStringList containing the icon paths

docfields.name: KIconLoader::reconfigure
docfields.text: This also clears the in-memory pixmap cache even if the appname didn t change which is useful for unittests appname the application name empty for the global iconloader extraSearchPaths additional search paths either absolute or relative to GenericDataLocation

docfields.name: KIconLoader::searchPaths

docfields.name: KIconLoader::theme
docfields.text: Can be used to query available and default sizes for groups The KIconTheme will change if reconfigure() is called and therefore it s not recommended to store the pointer anywhere a pointer to the current theme 0 if no theme set

docfields.name: KIconTheme
docfields.text: Class to use/access icon themes in KDE This class is used by the iconloader but can be used by others too You should not use this class externally This class is exported because the KCM needs it KIconLoader

docfields.name: KIconTheme::ContextMenus
docfields.text: For ReadOnlyText the menu is expected to have one entry TextEditor is expected to have the full complement of undo redo cut copy paste and clear

docfields.name: KIconTheme::KIconTheme
docfields.text: name the name of the theme e.g or appName the name of the application Can be null This argument allows applications to have themed application icons basePathHint optional hint where to search the app themes This is appended at the end of the search paths

docfields.name: KIconTheme::defaultSize
docfields.text: group The icon group See KIconLoader::Group The default size in pixels for the given icon group

docfields.name: KIconTheme::depth
docfields.text: This can either be 8 or 32 the minimum bpp 8 or 32

docfields.name: KIconTheme::description
docfields.text: a human-readable description of the theme QString() if there is none

docfields.name: KIconTheme::dir
docfields.text: the directory of the theme

docfields.name: KIconTheme::example
docfields.text: This can be used to present the theme to the user the name of the example icon QString() if there is none

docfields.name: KIconTheme::followsColorScheme
docfields.text: This is necessary for monochrome themes that should look visible on both light and dark color schemes true if the SVG will be colorized with a stylesheet 5.22

docfields.name: KIconTheme::iconPath
docfields.text: name The name of the icon with extension size The desired size of the icon match The matching mode KIconLoader::MatchExact returns an icon only if matches exactly KIconLoader::MatchBest returns the best matching icon An absolute path to the file of the icon if it s found QString() otherwise KIconLoader::isValid will return true and false otherwise

docfields.name: KIconTheme::iconPathByName
docfields.text: name The name of the icon without extension size The desired size of the icon match The matching mode KIconLoader::MatchExact returns an icon only if matches exactly KIconLoader::MatchBest returns the best matching icon An absolute path to the file of the icon if it s found QString() otherwise KIconLoader::isValid will return true and false otherwise 5.22

docfields.text: a list of icon themes that are used as fall-backs

docfields.name: KIconTheme::internalName
docfields.text: the internal name of the theme

docfields.name: KIconTheme::isHidden
docfields.text: true if the icon theme is hidden

docfields.name: KIconTheme::isValid
docfields.text: true if the icon theme is valid

docfields.name: KIconTheme::name
docfields.text: the human-readable name of the theme

docfields.name: KIconTheme::queryIcons
docfields.text: size the size of the icons context the context of the icons the list of icon names

docfields.name: KIconTheme::queryIconsByContext
docfields.text: size the size of the icons context the context of the icons the list of icon names

docfields.name: KIconTheme::querySizes
docfields.text: group The icon group See KIconLoader::Group a list of available sizes for the given group

docfields.name: KIconTheme::screenshot
docfields.text: the name of the screenshot QString() if there is none

docfields.name: KIconTheme::current
docfields.text: the name of the current theme

docfields.name: KIconTheme::defaultThemeName
docfields.text: the name of the default theme name

docfields.name: KIconTheme::forceThemeForTests
docfields.text: To reset a forced theme simply set an empty themeName themeName name of the theme to force as current theme or an empty string to unset theme forcing This should only be used when a very precise expectation about the current theme is present Most notably in unit tests this can be used to force a given theme A forced theme persists across reconfigure() calls! current 5.23

docfields.name: KIconTheme::list
docfields.text: the list of all icon themes

docfields.name: index
docfields.text: KIconThemes Icon GUI utilities Introduction This library contains classes to improve the handling of icons in applications using the KDE Frameworks Provided are KIconDialog Dialog class to let the user select an icon from the list of installed icons KIconButton Custom button class that displays an icon When clicking it the user can change it using the icon dialog KIconEffect Applies various colorization effects to icons which can be used to create selected/disabled icon images Other classes in this repository are used internally by the icon theme configuration dialogs and should not be used by applications Icon Theme Deployment On Linux/BSD it is expected that the main icon themes hicolor oxygen breeze are installed by the distribution The platform theme plugin reads the icon theme name from KConfig and redirects QIcon::fromTheme calls to KIconEngine/KIconLoader which brings some benefits over Qt s internal icon loading such as a cache shared between processes On other platforms such as Windows and Mac OS icon themes are not part of the system The deployment strategy for applications on those operations systems is the following breeze-icons and other icon themes when configured with ON install rcc files binary resources loadable by Qt the installation process should copy one of these under the name in a directory found by QStandardPaths::AppDataLocation For instance on Windows icontheme.rcc is usually installed in APPROOT/data/ while on Mac OS it is installed in the Resources directory inside the application bundle as long as the application links to KIconThemes even if it doesn t use any of its API the icontheme.rcc file will be found on startup loaded and set as the default icon theme
